A lawyer is preparing to interview a child victim. Which of the following approaches best reflects a child-friendly justice practice?
texts.content_text100: Conduct the interview using formal legal terminology to ensure accuracy.
texts.content_text101: Begin by building rapport and explain the process in language the child can understand.
texts.content_text102: Ask rapid, detailed questions to minimise the length of the meeting.
texts.content_text103: Speak only to the child’s guardian to avoid putting pressure on the child.
